text: but I guess we're ferocious readers cuz
we can't sit sit anywhere without
reading something sitting in a waiting
room on a train we are nuts if we don't
have something to read I read about five
newspapers a day I read a number of
weekly magazines and I would say I
always read some book before I go to
sleep at night David Sims and his wife
Jane clearly enjoy reading every room in
their house in Greenwich Connecticut is
strewn with books and newspapers I don't
go anywhere without a newspaper or
magazine or a book I'm probably at the
library three or four times a week we
are very big users at the library and
their son Zach enjoys reading too but
just not in the same way my family sort
of has a great relationship with reading
but I read a lot more online I can say
confidently than the rest of my family
and they probably read more in print
than I do at least since the invention
of television critics have warned that
electronic media would destroy reading
by diminishing literacy and wrecking
attention spans
but accomplished readers like Zach are
redefining what it means to read in a
digital age when you're reading online
you can read a lot of different things
about a lot of different subjects in a
short period of time whereas if you're
reading a book usually it's about one
subject I would say I'm reading a lot of
I guess user-generated content that one
wouldn't find in paper form so a lot of
different blogs I'm subscribed to
something like 100 or 200 RSS feeds that
I read every day and reading sort of
aggregators that bring together a lot of
information from different sources
sure Zachary likes books but he craves
interaction with fellow readers it's
about the conversation as opposed to if
you were just receive it in paper it's
just like you read and you're done with
it and I think putting it online sort of
takes it a step further
his mother is staggered by the amount of
content and Zach absorbs every day it's
mind-boggling to me if he had to go pick
up all of those resources in print it
would be almost impossible still she
thinks that reading in print and on the
Internet
are two different animals I don't think
about reading on my computer as a quiet
activity I think about sitting and
reading in my comfy chair curled up with
my book I I don't curl up with my
computer but like many in their
generation Zach and Emma do I don't
think it's a bad thing I think when used
are looking at the amount of time that's
spent on social networking and I am a
that's where I have a problem the sims
like a lot of parents are concerned that
their daughter spends most of her time
online playing games not reading I think
that it's very important especially when
the kids are young for them to read I
think it enriches their vocabulary I
also think that it helps to lay the
foundation for good writing skills Zac
for his part is obsessed with reading on
any digital device even reading
headlines on his iPhone on the train
ride home I wouldn't say it's an
unhealthy amount of time than spending
online I have a Facebook I do instant
message with friends like you have
friends but I think they recognize the
fact that it's a lot of reading it's
becoming more informed about the world
and more informed about things you care
about some literacy experts believe
there are online reading skills that
could ultimately help children fare
better in school like the ability to
locate information quickly or even type
faster David thinks that these and other
skills will serve Zach well at Columbia
University in the fall he's learned
various ways on multiple levels to do
research
he's a very inquisitive kid so when he
is interested in the subject instead of
using the Internet if it didn't exist he
would have been in the library all the
time going through research books to
study a subject while the debate
continues for educators and researchers
about the virtues of online reading for
this family reading and whatever form it
takes is valuable I think that reading
is really the basis of wall of all
learning and I think whether it's a book
or whether it's on the internet if
you're reading and digging you're
learning so I'd like to think that you
know that's where we all can gain a
great deal
